element.definition: The definition of an action to be performed. Some aspects of the definition are specified statically, and some aspects can be specified dynamically by referencing logic defined in a library.
element.short: The definition of an action to be performed

element.definition: A unique identifier for the action. The identifier SHALL be unique within the container in which it appears, and MAY be universally unique.
A user-visible label for the action.
element.short: User-visible label for the action (e.g. 1. or A.)

element.definition: The title of the action displayed to a user.
A short description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that may not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.
element.short: Static text equivalent of the action, used if the dynamic aspects cannot be interpreted by the receiving system

element.definition: The concept represented by this action or its sub-actions.
element.short: The meaning of the action or its sub-actions

element.definition: The evidence grade and the sources of evidence for this action.
element.short: Evidence that supports taking the action

element.definition: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.
element.short: Supporting documentation for the intended performer of the action

element.definition: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".
The unique identifier of the related action.

binding.description: Defines the types of relationships between actions

element.definition: The relationship of this action to the related action.
A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

binding.description: Defines possible anchors for the relationship between actions

element.definition: An optional indicator for how the relationship is anchored to the related action. For example "before the start" or "before the end" of the related action.

binding.description: The type of participant for the action

element.definition: The type of participant in the action.

binding.description: The type of action to be performed

element.definition: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).
A behavior associated with the action. Behaviors define how the action is to be presented and/or executed within the receiving environment.
element.short: Defines behaviors such as selection and grouping

binding.description: The type of behavior to be defined

element.definition: The type of the behavior to be described, such as grouping, visual, or selection behaviors.
element.short: The type of behavior (grouping, precheck, selection, cardinality, etc)

element.definition: The specific behavior. The code used here is determined by the type of behavior being described. For example, the grouping behavior uses the grouping-behavior-type valueset.
element.short: Specific behavior (e.g. required, at-most-one, single, etc)

element.comments: Note that the resource is optional, and if no resource is specified, a customization with a root (/) path can be used to define the entire resource dynamically.
element.definition: The resource that is the target of the action (e.g. CommunicationRequest). The resource described here defines any aspects of the action that can be specified statically (i.e. are known at the time of definition).
element.short: Static portion of the action definition

element.definition: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.
The path to the element to be customized. This is the path on the resource that will hold the result of the calculation defined by the expression.
element.short: The path to the element to be set dynamically

element.definition: An expression specifying the value of the customized element.
element.short: An expression that provides the dynamic value for the customization

element.definition: Sub actions that are contained within the action. The behavior of this action determines the functionality of the sub-actions. For example, a selection behavior of at-most-one indicates that of the sub-actions, at most one may be chosen as part of realizing the action definition.
The definition of an action to be performed. Some aspects of the definition are specified statically, and some aspects can be specified dynamically by referencing logic defined in a library.
element.short: The definition of an action to be performed

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
ActionDefinition ΣElementThe definition of an action to be performed
actionIdentifier Σ0..1IdentifierUnique identifier
label Σ0..1stringUser-visible label for the action (e.g. 1. or A.)
title Σ0..1stringUser-visible title
description Σ0..1stringShort description of the action
textEquivalent Σ0..1stringStatic text equivalent of the action, used if the dynamic aspects cannot be interpreted by the receiving system
concept Σ0..*CodeableConceptThe meaning of the action or its sub-actions
supportingEvidence Σ0..*AttachmentEvidence that supports taking the action
documentation Σ0..*AttachmentSupporting documentation for the intended performer of the action
relatedAction Σ0..1ElementRelationship to another action
actionIdentifier Σ1..1IdentifierIdentifier of the related action
relationship Σ1..1codebefore | after
ActionRelationshipType (Required)
offset[x] Σ0..1Time offset for the relationship
offsetDurationDuration
offsetRangeRange
anchor Σ0..1codestart | end
ActionRelationshipAnchor (Required)
participantType Σ0..*codepatient | practitioner | related-person
ParticipantType (Required)
type Σ0..1codecreate | update | remove | fire-event
ActionType (Extensible)
behavior Σ0..*ElementDefines behaviors such as selection and grouping
type Σ1..1CodingThe type of behavior (grouping, precheck, selection, cardinality, etc)
ActionBehaviorType (Extensible)
value Σ1..1CodingSpecific behavior (e.g. required, at-most-one, single, etc)
resource Σ0..1Reference(Any)Static portion of the action definition
customization Σ0..*ElementDynamic aspects of the definition
path Σ1..1stringThe path to the element to be set dynamically
expression Σ1..1stringAn expression that provides the dynamic value for the customization
action Σ0..*ActionDefinitionA sub-action

Documentation for this format
